intro: Vallea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf vallea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have four petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests.
